questions.text: Identify the surgical procedure: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Penectomy with inguinal dissection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Penectomy with inguinal dissection is a treatment approach for penile cancer, involving removal of the penis and associated lymph node dissection to manage local and regional disease spread.

questions.text: All of the following are associated with massive splenomegaly except: (AIIMS NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Aplastic anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aplastic anemia is a syndrome of chronic primary hematopoietic failure. This results in pancytopenia (anemia, neutropenia, and thrombocytopenia). Splenomegaly is characteristically absent; if it is present, the diagnosis of aplastic anemia should be seriously questioned. Similarly, splenomegaly is also never seen in cases of ITP.
  • ➤ Splenomegaly is characteristically absent; if it is present, the diagnosis of aplastic anemia should be seriously questioned. Similarly, splenomegaly is also never seen in cases of ITP.
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins pathologic basis of disease 8 th edition pg. 1239, 1173
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins pathologic basis of disease 8 th edition pg. 1239, 1173

questions.text: Which vaccine among the options is not recommended for use during pregnancy? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Varicella

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Chemoprophylaxis for leprosy should be given to which of the following persons? (INICET NOVEMBER 2022) Sharing the same clothes, towels Living with a patient with leprosy for > 6 month Contact of age more than 2 years Contact for more than 20 hours per week.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2, 3, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chemoprophylaxis for leprosy is crucial for contacts who have had significant exposure to an individual with leprosy, particularly those living in the same household or in close contact for extended periods.
  • ➤ Rifampicin:
  • ➤ Rifampicin:
  • ➤ A single dose of 600 mg kills more than 99% of the susceptible organisms present at the start of treatment, that is as much as 3 to 6 months of daily treatment with the combination dapsone plus Clofazimine. Rifampicin has become established as a highly potent bactericidal drug , and it acts by inhibiting the bacterial DNA dependent RNA polymerase . Single Dose of Rifampicin (SDR) is used in chemoprophylaxis. Chemoprophylaxis must be initiated only 4 weeks after treatment for leprosy has begun in the patient so as to ensure the patient is non-infectious .
  • ➤ A single dose of 600 mg kills more than 99% of the susceptible organisms present at the start of treatment, that is as much as 3 to 6 months of daily treatment with the combination dapsone plus Clofazimine.

questions.text: A patient present with Cotton wool skull. Most likely diagnosis is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Paget's disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "cotton wool" appearance of the skull on radiographs is a classic sign of Paget's disease. This pattern results from the chaotic bone remodelling process characteristic of this condition.
  • ➤ The "cotton wool" appearance of the skull on radiographs is a classic sign of Paget's disease.
  • ➤ This pattern results from the chaotic bone remodelling process characteristic of this condition.

questions.text: A pediatric surgeon is planning the optimal timing for cleft palate surgery on a young patient. For the repair of the soft palate, at what age should the surgery ideally be performed? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 3 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The timing of cleft palate surgery –
  • ➤ For the soft palate, surgery is ideally conducted at 3 -6 months For the hard palate repair is done at 12-15 months.
  • ➤ For the soft palate, surgery is ideally conducted at 3 -6 months
  • ➤ For the hard palate repair is done at 12-15 months.

questions.text: In triage, immediately life-threatening injury is categorized as what color code? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Red

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a triage situation, an immediately life-threatening injury is classified under the Red color code , indicating the need for urgent medical intervention.
  • ➤ immediately life-threatening injury is classified under the Red color code

questions.text: An individual experiences intense fear and anxiety when confronted with tall structures and the prospect of looking down from great heights. Which term best describes this condition? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Acrophobia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acrophobia is the term used to describe the fear of heights, a common phobia that can cause significant distress and avoidance behavior in individuals.

questions.text: In a community, there were 550 births in a year out of which 50 were stillbirths. There were 09 deaths among newborns during 0-7 days of life. An additional 41 deaths occurred during 8-28 days of life. Calculate the Early Neonatal Mortality rate for the given community. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 18

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Early Neonatal Mortality Rate is calculated as the number of early neonatal deaths (0-7 days) per 1,000 live births.

questions.text: Injury to which nerve results in absent gag reflex? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) IX & X

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The gag reflex involves the Glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) for sensory input and the Vagus nerve (CN X) for motor response. Damage to either nerve can result in an absent gag reflex.

questions.text: Which HLA is associated with Reiter’s syndrome? (FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) HLA B27

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HLA-B27 is strongly associated with reactive arthritis (Reiter's syndrome) and other spondyloarthropathies like ankylosing spondylitis, psoriatic arthritis, and enteropathic arthritis. Approximately 75-80% of patients with reactive arthritis test positive for HLA-B27. But it should not be used as a diagnostic tool for acute ReA.
  • ➤ HLA-B27 is strongly associated with reactive arthritis (Reiter's syndrome) and other spondyloarthropathies like ankylosing spondylitis, psoriatic arthritis, and enteropathic arthritis.
  • ➤ Approximately 75-80% of patients with reactive arthritis test positive for HLA-B27.
  • ➤ But it should not be used as a diagnostic tool for acute ReA.

questions.text: A skull was recovered from a forest. According to inquest papers, woman had gone missing after a fight with her boyfriend a month back. The skull was sent to the forensic research lab. Which of the following would identify it as a female skull? ( INICET May 2021) Large frontal and parietal eminence Heavy cheek bones Smooth glabella Square orbits Narrow mastoid
questions.explanation: Ans.

questions.text: A child with infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis has multiple episodes of non-bilious vomiting. Which of the following metabolic abnormalities is likely to be seen in this condition? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hypochloremic, hypokalemic alkalosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis leads to hypochloremic, hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis due to persistent vomiting and loss of gastric acid.

questions.text: A 23-year-old medical student with a 2-month history of palpitations, sweating, and restlessness. He also complains of a sweaty palm. His appearance is as shown in the picture. What is the next step in evaluation? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first and most crucial test in the evaluation of suspected hyperthyroidism, such as in a case suggestive of Graves' disease, is the measurement of ultrasensitive thyrotropin (TSH) levels.
  • ➤ Confirmatory Diagnosis – by TRAbs (Thyroid receptor antibodies)

questions.text: Identify the following image: ( INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Ranula

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman, having lost her newborn, is producing breast milk, which risks developing into a breast abscess due to milk stasis and incomplete emptying. Which drug can prevent this complication? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cabergoline, a dopamine receptor agonist, is used to suppress lactation by inhibiting prolactin secretion, thereby preventing complications like milk stasis and breast abscess.

questions.text: Where does the maximum water absorption occur within the renal tubules? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) PCT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Proximal Convoluted Tubule (PCT) is the site of maximum water absorption within the renal tubules, reabsorbing about 60-65% of the filtered water.

questions.text: A female presented with loss of pain and temperature, but her touch sensation was intact. Imaging showed cavitation around the central canal. What is the probable diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Syringomyelia presents with a loss of pain and temperature sensation while preserving touch sensation, and is characterized by cavitation around the central canal of the spinal cord.

questions.text: A patient presents with xanthomas on the Achilles tendon. Which of the following is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Familial hypercholesterolemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Familial hypercholesterolemia is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels and the presence of tendon xanthomas, particularly on the Achilles tendon

questions.text: Which of the following is a true statement about congenital CMV infection? (INICET MAY 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: About 20-30% of the infections are symptomatic

options.label: B
options.text: Triad of SNHL, periventricular calcification and enamel hypoplasia

options.label: C
options.text: Most children asymptomatic at birth can develop conductive hearing loss later in life

options.label: D
options.text: If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection

questions.correct_answer: D. If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maternal IgG positivity for CMV suggests a lower risk of congenital CMV transmission, making it less likely for the fetus to develop the infection.

questions.text: Which of the following increase the risk of recurrence of febrile seizures? (INICET MAY 2022) Age < 1 year Temperature of 38-39°C Duration of fever < 24 h Duration of fever > 48 h
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The risk of recurrent febrile seizures is increased in children under 1 year of age, with fever temperatures between 38-39°C, and fever lasting less than 24 hours.

questions.text: A patient presenting with multiple humeral shaft fracture, following which he had difficulty in flexion of elbow and supination of forearm. He also complaints of loss of sensation over lateral side of forearm. Which nerve is damaged? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Musculocutaneous nerve

questions.text: Which of the following protein deficiency is responsible for Hereditary Angioedema? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A patient presented with diarrhea, dermatitis, and dementia. Which of the following vitamin deficiencies would you suspect in this patient? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Vitamin B3 deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Following image shows Casal’s Necklace & hyperpigmentation of sun-exposed limbs:

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman with a long history of dyspnea, chronic cough with sputum, and wheezing died of respiratory failure following a bout of lobar pneumonia. She was not a smoker or an alcoholic. The lung at autopsy is shown in the image below. Which of the following is most likely to cause the pathological changes shown? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency is a genetic disorder leading to a lack of AAT, which protects the lung tissue from elastase. The deficiency causes panacinar emphysema, characterized by uniform enlargement of acini, particularly in the lower lobes of the lung, and presents with chronic respiratory symptoms.

questions.text: The corrected refractory error is: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Presbyopia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Presbyopia is unique among refractive conditions as its correction (typically with reading glasses) results in clear near vision without altering distance vision, effectively achieving a "corrected" state for both near and far vision

questions.text: A woman presents to you with fever, arthralgia, ulcers, fatigue for the past six months, and new-onset hematuria. Urine examination reveals RBC casts and proteinuria. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lupus nephritis should be suspected in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus who present with renal symptoms such as hematuria and proteinuria, especially when accompanied by systemic symptoms like fever, arthralgia, ulcers, and fatigue. Further testing, including ANA and anti-dsDNA antibodies, is warranted to confirm the diagnosis.

questions.text: Basiocciput fuses with basisphenoid at what age? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 18-22 years

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fusion of Basiocciput with basisphenoid is seen around 18-22 years.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male patient with critical mitral stenosis presented with atrial fibrillation. He has a history of multiple episodes of transient ischemic attacks. Which of the following are true regarding the prevention of stroke in this patient? (INICET NOV 2021) Only aspirin is given Warfarin is given Direct oral anticoagulants are not indicated Mitral valvotomy should be recommended
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with critical mitral stenosis and atrial fibrillation, especially those with a history of TIA, Warfarin should be given for stroke prevention, and direct oral anticoagulants are not indicated.

questions.text: The given image shows a normal graph on the left and the patient's graph on the right. Which of the following diagnoses can be inferred from the graph? ( INICET Nov 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The spirometry graph compares a normal patient's lung function with that of the patient. The normal graph shows an FEV1/FVC ratio (Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second / Forced Vital Capacity) of more than 70%, which is typical in healthy individuals. In contrast, the patient's graph shows a significantly reduced FEV1/FVC ratio of approximately 50-55%, indicating an obstructive lung disease.
  • • Obstructive lung diseases are characterized by reduced airflow due to airway narrowing or obstruction, leading to a lower FEV1/FVC ratio. The common obstructive lung diseases include asthma, emphysema, chronic bronchitis, COPD, bronchiectasis, and cystic fibrosis. Among the given options, bronchiectasis is the only obstructive lung disease.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Chest wall neuromuscular disease: This typically causes restrictive lung disease, not obstructive, and would present with a normal or high FEV1/FVC ratio but reduced lung volumes.
  • • Option A. Chest wall neuromuscular disease:
  • • Option B. Sarcoidosis: This is an interstitial lung disease, which is restrictive. It would show a normal or elevated FEV1/FVC ratio with reduced lung volumes.
  • • Option B. Sarcoidosis:
  • • Option C. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: Another interstitial lung disease leading to restrictive patterns on spirometry, characterized by a normal or high FEV1/FVC ratio with reduced total lung capacity.
  • • Option C. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A reduced FEV1/FVC ratio (<70%) is indicative of obstructive lung disease. Among the given options, bronchiectasis is the obstructive lung disease associated with this spirometry pattern.

questions.text: In spine straightening surgeries, screws used for fixation are inserted through which of the following parts of the vertebra? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pedicle of the vertebra is the area used to fixate the screws through during the spine straightening surgeries for scoliosis.
  • ➤ Pedicle of the vertebra is the area used to fixate the screws through during the spine straightening surgeries for scoliosis.
  • ➤ Pedicle of the vertebra is the area used to fixate the screws through during the spine straightening surgeries for scoliosis.

questions.text: A woman with recurrent diarrhea is prescribed a broad-spectrum antibiotic. Which of the following is not true regarding Clostridium difficile infection? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Oral fidaxomicin is used for treatment

options.label: C
options.text: IgM assay is used to confirm the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: Pseudomembrane consists of leukocytes, fibrin, and cellular debris

questions.correct_answer: C. IgM assay is used to confirm the diagnosis
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) IgM assay is used to confirm the diagnosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Clostridium difficile infection is diagnosed primarily through the detection of toxins rather than IgM assays is crucial for appropriate management. This recognition guides the effective use of specific treatments such as oral fidaxomicin or vancomycin, aimed at countering the effects of these toxins and managing the symptoms of the infection.

questions.text: The defined population norm for Urban-Primary health centre in our country is one such centre per: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1 per 50,000

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The population norm for establishing an Urban Primary Health Centre (UPHC) in India is one center per 50,000 populations.

questions.text: What is the best contrast agent for the diagnosis of esophageal perforation? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Iohexol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 13-year-old boy presents with right-sided nasal obstruction and recurrent epistaxis for the past 6 months. What is the most likely diagnosis? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) JNA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma (JNA) is the most likely diagnosis for a 13-year-old boy with right-sided nasal obstruction and recurrent epistaxis, as it commonly presents in adolescent males with these symptoms.

questions.text: Which of the following are signs of heart failure? (INICET NOV 2022) Non-pulsatile rise of JVP Orthopnea Dyspnea after 2 hours of sleep Right upper quadrant pain/Right hypochondrial pain
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 2, 3, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Signs of heart failure include orthopnea, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea (PND), and right upper quadrant pain due to congestive hepatomegaly.

questions.text: An auxiliary nurse midwife is tasked with organizing a vaccination camp within a rural community. She has been provided with 2 vials that have been unsealed. Among these, one contains a pentavalent vaccine, while the other holds an MR vaccine. What options does she have in terms of effectively using these vials? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Use MR vaccine and discard pentavalent vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Use pentavalent vaccine and discard MR vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Under the Open Vial Policy, the auxiliary nurse midwife can use the pentavalent vaccine for subsequent sessions up to 4 weeks after opening, but must discard the MR vaccine as it does not fall under the Open Vial Policy.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct statement about a patient with a retroperitoneal mass, episodic hypertension, palpitations, and increased urinary VMA levels? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: It can be associated with MEN 2A

questions.correct_answer: D. It can be associated with MEN 2A
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) It can be associated with MEN 2A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pheochromocytomas are catecholamine-secreting tumors associated with episodic hypertension and increased urinary VMA levels. They are commonly linked with MEN 2A syndrome, which involves RET gene mutations.

questions.text: What is the ideal number of antenatal visits? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 12-14

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The ideal number of antenatal visits as recommended by various guidelines:
  • • MOHFW (Indian guidelines) : At least 4 visits including the first (registration visit) – minimum requirement. Suggested schedule: 1st Visit: Within 12 weeks 2nd Visit: 14-26 weeks 3rd Visit: 28-34 weeks 4th Visit: 36 weeks to term WHO (2016) : Recommends 8 visits: 1st Trimester: Contact 1: Up to 12 weeks 2nd Trimester: Contact 2: 20 weeks Contact 3: 26 weeks 3rd Trimester: Contact 4: 30 weeks Contact 5: 34 weeks Contact 6: 36 weeks Contact 7: 38 weeks Contact 8: 40 weeks ACOG (American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists) : Ideally recommends: Once every month till 28 weeks Every 2 weeks till 36 weeks Weekly till 40 weeks This totals approximately 12-14 visits.
  • • MOHFW (Indian guidelines) : At least 4 visits including the first (registration visit) – minimum requirement. Suggested schedule: 1st Visit: Within 12 weeks 2nd Visit: 14-26 weeks 3rd Visit: 28-34 weeks 4th Visit: 36 weeks to term
  • • MOHFW (Indian guidelines)
  • • At least 4 visits including the first (registration visit) – minimum requirement. Suggested schedule: 1st Visit: Within 12 weeks 2nd Visit: 14-26 weeks 3rd Visit: 28-34 weeks 4th Visit: 36 weeks to term

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient on immunosuppressive therapy presents with cough, fever, and pneumonia. A biopsy reveals the cells shown in the image. Which organism is responsible for this finding? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "owl eye" appearance of cells in a biopsy is a hallmark of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection, particularly in immunocompromised patients. This feature is crucial for diagnosing CMV-related complications, such as CMV pneumonia.
